title: vraven
author: vraven
content: Hello everyone,  I'm new user of bitcointalk. How I get Martie. I Found several scammer of bitcointalk.  They have  copied proof post. Where will I report about them. I posted but.  The post was deleted. Please Inform me About it,, if you know

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: vraven on April 13, 2023, 06:08:52 PMHello everyone,  I'm new user of bitcointalk. How I get Martie. I Found several scammer of bitcointalk.  They have  copied proof post. Where will I report about them. I posted but.  The post was deleted. Please Inform me About it,, if you know If you are sure that someone is scamming, and you have the proper proof of the scams they have done then the best child board for you is "scam accusations," at that board you can report those scammers. But, keep in mind that if you are accusing someone for scamming, and your proof is not showing enough details to prove the scam then you will be responsible for defaming that member whom you reported.It's always better to get proper proof of someone's scam before accusing the person. And, if you are accusing someone due to hatred or any other reason that has noting to do with scamming, then instead of that user you might get punished for such behavior.

Quote from: Timelord2067 on April 14, 2022, 10:23:36 AMNo "Newbie" or, "Junior Member" can post an investigation in this thread.  They can however post a link (once) to a thread in the reputation section where their investigations can be investigated and analised.The only way in which a newbie or Jr Member can post is if they are appealing NEGATIVE trust being left on their trust feedback page.  (If the post is neutral, then their appeal *may* be deleted)So it would be better for you to just create a new thread in the reputation board since you're trying to catch bounty cheaters. P.S. Why do I read the bolded text in your Op as "how do I get merit?" [1] https://ninjastic.space/post/62090544[2] https://ninjastic.space/post/62085279

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: They're not scammer, but cheater since you're trying to connect 2 or more accounts joined in a same campaign.Quote from: Cantsay on April 22, 2023, 02:15:31 AMSo it would be better for you to just create a new thread in the reputation board since you're trying to catch bounty cheaters. P.S. Why do I read the bolded text in your Op as "how do I get merit?" Although it's true he can create his own thread, but it's a bit ironic to see a 9 days old newbie account want to catch bounty cheaters? His main intention is to get merit, there's nothing wrong about it, but I will not trust him for anything due to this matter.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: You claim to be a newbie but your first post in the forum is about reporting bounty cheaters, I doubt that’s a reason anyone joins the forum. It’s very unlikely that a newbie would know that multiple accounts in bounty is against the rules. And how would a newbie know exactly what to look for to catch bounty cheaters. I believe this account is an alt and OP is looking for ways to earn merit.

Where will I report about them. I posted but.  The post was deleted. Please Inform me About it,, if you know Scammers are people who steal funds from others, or are likely to do that, if you think someone is a scammer you can start a new topic to tell other forum members and leave negative feedback too. comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Breaking the rules of a campaign does not tag one as a scammer. The forum has trsut flags which should be used for scams with different types. For a bounty cheater, a trust feedback (negative) is enough to point it out. The manager would see the tag and choose to act on it or not.If you choose to create a thread for linked accounts applying for the same bounty, a thread in reputation is more appropriate than scam accusation.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: If you are sure that the user you found is a scammer then you should create a scam accusation thread and provide the proof. Anyway, I have read your post and as what I have understand about your post is that someone is copying your forum information like the profile link, bitcointalk username and rank but I don't see it as a scam attempt but an impersonator or in short an impostor who wants to earn money by doing that. To avoid it from happening then you should report it to the bounty management that someone is cheating. I think martie is not yet available unless you are contributing to the forum then martie will come  .
